list_calendar_events.description: List calendar events for a specific date range. Defaults to next 30 days if no date specified.

start_datetime.description: Start datetime to filter events in UTC (ISO 8601 format, e.g., 2024-08-01T07:00:00Z). Recommended for timezone-aware queries

list_mail_folders.description: List mail folders in the user's mailbox. Returns folder IDs needed for move_email action. Use include_children=true to get all folders including nested subfolders.

get_mail_folder.description: Get details of a specific mail folder by ID or well-known name. Well-known names (lowercase): inbox, drafts, sentitems, deleteditems, junkemail, archive, outbox, clutter, scheduled, searchfolders, conversationhistory

folder_id.description: Folder ID or well-known folder name (lowercase, no spaces). Examples: 'inbox', 'drafts', 'deleteditems', 'junkemail', 'archive'

error.description: Error message if the operation failed

move_email.description: Move an email to a different folder. IMPORTANT: For custom folders, first use list_mail_folders with include_children=true to find the folder ID. For system folders, use well-known names (lowercase): inbox, drafts, sentitems, deleteditems, junkemail, archive, outbox, clutter, scheduled.

email_id.description: The ID of the email to move

destination_folder_id.description: Destination folder ID (from list_mail_folders) OR a well-known folder name (lowercase, no spaces). Well-known names: inbox, drafts, sentitems, deleteditems, junkemail, archive, outbox, clutter, scheduled. For custom folders like 'Clients' or 'Projects', you MUST use list_mail_folders first to get the folder ID.

id.description: The ID of the moved email

parentFolderId.description: The ID of the folder the email was moved to

find_meeting_times.description: Find available meeting time slots based on attendee availability, working hours, and optional room requirements. Uses Microsoft Graph findMeetingTimes API to suggest optimal meeting times with confidence ratings.

attendees.description: List of attendee email addresses to check availability for

duration_minutes.description: Duration of the meeting in minutes (default: 60)

start_datetime.description: Start of the time range to search for available slots (ISO 8601 UTC, e.g., 2024-08-01T08:00:00Z). Defaults to now.

end_datetime.description: End of the time range to search for available slots (ISO 8601 UTC, e.g., 2024-08-05T18:00:00Z). Defaults to 7 days from start.

max_candidates.description: Maximum number of meeting time suggestions to return (default: 10, max: 20)

is_organizer_optional.description: Whether the organizer is optional for the meeting (default: false)

meeting_duration_preference.description: Preference for time of day: morning, afternoon, or evening

location_constraint.description: Room or location email address to include as a required resource

minimum_attendee_percentage.description: Minimum percentage of attendees that must be available (0-100, default: 100)

meeting_time_suggestions.description: List of suggested meeting time slots ranked by confidence

confidence.description: Confidence score (0-100) that all attendees can make this time

organizer_availability.description: Organizer's availability status for this slot

attendee_availability.description: Each attendee's availability status for this slot

availability.description: Availability status (free, tentative, busy, unavailable, unknown)

suggested_locations.description: Suggested meeting locations/rooms for this slot

empty_suggestions_reason.description: Reason why no suggestions were returned (if applicable)

error.description: Error message if the operation failed

get_schedule.description: Get the free/busy availability schedule for one or more users or rooms for a specific time range. Returns detailed availability information including busy time slots.

start_datetime.description: Start of the time range (ISO 8601 UTC, e.g., 2024-08-01T08:00:00Z)

end_datetime.description: End of the time range (ISO 8601 UTC, e.g., 2024-08-01T18:00:00Z)

availability_view_interval.description: Time slot duration in minutes for the availability view string (default: 30, range: 5-1440)

schedules.description: Availability schedules for each requested email

email.description: The email address of the user/room

availability_view.description: Merged availability string (0=free, 1=tentative, 2=busy, 3=out of office, 4=working elsewhere)

schedule_items.description: List of calendar items in the time range

status.description: Availability status (free, tentative, busy, oof, workingElsewhere, unknown)

start.description: Start time of this calendar item

end.description: End time of this calendar item

subject.description: Subject of the calendar item (if available)

location.description: Location of the calendar item (if available)

is_private.description: Whether this is a private event

working_hours.description: Working hours configuration for this user

error.description: Error for this specific schedule if retrieval failed

room_list_email.description: Email address of a room list (required when list_type is 'rooms_in_list'). Get room list emails from list_type='room_lists'.

limit.description: Maximum number of rooms to return (default: 100)

rooms.description: List of rooms or room lists

email_address.description: Room email address (use this for booking)

is_wheelchair_accessible.description: Whether the room is wheelchair accessible

error.description: Error message if the operation failed

check_room_availability.description: Check if specific meeting rooms are available during a given time range. Returns free/busy status for each room to help with room booking decisions.

start_datetime.description: Start of the time range to check (ISO 8601 UTC, e.g., 2024-08-01T14:00:00Z)

end_datetime.description: End of the time range to check (ISO 8601 UTC, e.g., 2024-08-01T15:00:00Z)

rooms.description: Availability status for each requested room

conflicts.description: List of conflicting bookings during the requested time range
